page.title: Download NDOC
page.body:
Obviously, you're going to need Microsoft's .NET Framework SDK installed on your machine. See
how to get it from Microsoft, if you don't already have it.
In order to compile the generated HTML files into a CHM file, you're going to need the HTML Help Compiler (hhc.exe) which can be found in Microsoft's
HTML Help Workshop. If you've installed Visual Studio .NET then you probably already have this (look for the
C:\Program Files\HTML Help Workshop\ folder).
To integrate your class libraries documentation with the Visual Studio .NET help content, your will also need the
Visual Studio .NET Help Integration Kit.
To get the latest sources, check them out of CVS. Since this code is under active development, it might not be in perfect working condition (even though we try really hard not to check something in if it doesn't work).
For those of you who don't want to (or can't) use CVS but still want the latest bits, we automatically archive the code in CVS every morning at 3 AM (Pacific time, GMT-8) and make it available for download.
If you'd rather use a more "stable" release, you can download the release from SourceForge. This release supports both the .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1, and has limited support for the mono:: runtime.
We also have a
web installer which will download and install the latest release of NDoc (runs only on the .NET Framework 1.1).
